definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: Many Japanese regarded him as the ablest Chinese strategist alive.
sentences.chinese: 許多日本人都認爲他是中國現有的最有才幹的戰略家。

sentences.english: In old society many talented young people were too often ploughed under.
sentences.chinese: 在舊社會許多有才幹的青年常被埋沒。

sentences.english: She is the ablest girl I've ever met.
sentences.chinese: 她是我見到過的最有才幹的姑娘。

sentences.english: Many optimists I know are quick to point out that others have talents superior to theirs.
sentences.chinese: 我認識的許多樂觀主義者會很快指出其他人更有才幹。

sentences.english: The most brilliant leadership can be mired in detail.
sentences.chinese: 最有才幹的領導也會陷於拘泥瑣事的困境中。
人人都知道她很有才幹。

sentences.english: He was a very competent lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位很有才幹的法學家。

sentences.english: Their attitude was that a guy with talent could climb any mountain .
sentences.chinese: 他們的想法是，一個有才幹的人，什麼山都能爬上去。

sentences.english: The Chinese nation has brought forth a lot of competent national heroes and revolutionary leaders.
sentences.chinese: 中華民族孕育了許多有才幹的民族英雄和革命領袖。

sentences.english: He is the ablest man I know.
sentences.chinese: 他是我所認識的最有才幹的人。

sentences.english: The great wealth of Clavius's family easily attracted the highest caliber of warriors.
sentences.chinese: 克萊文思家的鉅額財富能輕易吸引到最有才幹的戰士。
